text: Jean-Marc Fontaine (13 March 1944 – 29 January 2019) was a French mathematician. He was one of the founders of p-adic Hodge theory. He was a professor at Paris-Sud 11 University from 1988 to his death. He was born in Boulogne-Billancourt, France. In 1984 he received the Prix Carrière from the French Academy of Sciences. Beginning in 2002 he was a member of the French Academy of Sciences. In 2014 he was elected a member of the Academia Europaea. Fontaine died on 29 January 2019 in Paris from thyroid cancer at the age of 74.Décès de Jean-Marc Fontaine ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2019 deaths Category:People from Boulogne-Billancourt Category:French academics Category:French mathematicians Category:Members of Academia Europaea
